New Records: Manny Machado tied the Padres' record for career homers with his 163rd homer, matching Nate Colbert's 50-year old record.
Key Match Events: Manny Machado hit two home runs, including his 25th of the year.
Michael King fanned eight in six innings and limited San Francisco to one run on six hits and a walk.
Three relievers threw hitless ball over the last three innings.
The Padres put up three runs in the first inning with the help of a big defensive gaffe by the Giants.
Michael Conforto led off the sixth with his 16th homer into the seats in right field.
Miscellaneous Highlights: San Diego gained ground in the National League playoff race, going up by 1 1/2 games over Arizona for the top wild-card spot.
The Padres drew within four games of first-place Los Angeles in the NL West.
The Giants lost for the fifth time in six games.
